name: Vaadin.ContextMenuOverlayElement

properties.name: owner
properties.description: Owner element passed with renderer function

properties.name: renderer
properties.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of the overlay.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The root container DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `owner` The host element of the renderer function.
- `model` The object with the properties related with rendering.

properties.name: template
properties.description: The template of the overlay content.

properties.name: content
properties.description: References the content container after the template is stamped.

properties.name: model
properties.description: Object with properties that is passed to `renderer` function

properties.name: modeless
properties.description:
When true the overlay won't disable the main content, showing
it doesn’t change the functionality of the user interface.

properties.name: focusTrap
properties.description:
When true move focus to the first focusable element in the overlay,
or to the overlay if there are no focusable elements.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-close
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-close
fired before the `vaadin-overlay` will be closed. If canceled the closing of the overlay is canceled as well.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-escape-press
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-escape-press
fired before the `vaadin-overlay` will be closed on ESC button press. If canceled the closing of the overlay is canceled as well.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-open
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-open
fired after the `vaadin-overlay` is opened.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-outside-click
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-outside-click
fired before the `vaadin-overlay` will be closed on outside click. If canceled the closing of the overlay is canceled as well.

description:
The overlay element.

### Styling

See [`<vaadin-overlay>` documentation](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-overlay/blob/master/src/vaadin-overlay.html)
for `<vaadin-context-menu-overlay>` parts.

See [ThemableMixin – how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)
